text: You decide to go to the mountains and bring boulders back to build a bridge. No cart needed. You'll use your hands.
You go for a jog around Lake Beam. The friendly environment invigorates you.
You grab a book from your collection and begin reading. It is a rare guide to magic.
You go into the city to purchase supplies for your next adventure. You learn quite a bit about haggling.
You run in to the local boxing champion. He challenges you to a friendly fight. You win!
An angry man dressed in rediculous robes challenges you to a magic duel. You win, but you learn a thing or two about shady magic.
You purchase a potion from a wandering alchemist. You drink it and feel like a new person.
You spend some time with a local inventor who shows you a thing or two about mechanical engineering.
Some local kids need your help finding a rare species of Botomon. After several hours you're able to catch one.
You are invited to attend a meeting between mage knights in the area. They celebrate your accomplishments and teach you of their ways.
You are asked to help move a friend out of their home. You reluctantly agree to help.
You head to the local bar to play a few hands of cards. One person at the table is cheater, and you learn a few tricks.
You decide to spend the day bulk cooking meals for the week. It saves money. You manage to mix an alchemical ingredient to better preserve the food.
You get into a pushup competition with a group of young men. When one man is left, you switch to one arm just to show him up.
You decide to take on a new hobby. Dance! The instructor laughs at your initial attempts, but you get much better! You even win a bet between the beginners!
You manage to mix together a potion that can give extrodinary luck. You excitedly go to the market to sell it. After you do you realize you forgot to write down the recipe.
